title: Obama Presidential Library: NSC Correspondence Related to the New York Times Magazine article "The Agency" by Adrian Chen

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All information, analyses, summaries, assessments, transcripts, news clippings, email threads, text messages, or similar records included in National Security Correspondence related to an article titled "The Agency" written by a journalist named Adrian Chen and published in The New York Times Magazine on June 2nd of 2015. 

Here is a link to the article, please include a specific search for this URL: https://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/07/magazine/the-agency.html

This article was one of the first detailed accounts of the tactics of the Internet Research Agency, a Kremlin affiliated project to influence the 2016 campaign.

For the purposes of this request please search for where this article was shared or discussed in NSC Correspondence. Limit the search to the date of the article's publication of June 2nd 2015 to January 20th of 2017.

Keywords and search terms:
(Please search for the original URL): https://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/07/magazine/the-agency.html
"Adrian Chen"
"The Agency"

Thank you for the Obama Presidential Library's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

A list (in Excel or CSV format) of all police officers who were employed by the Boston Police Department (BPD) in 1995 and 2000. Please include badge number, first name, last name, start date, and end/retirement date (if applicable).

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act (KRS 61.870 et seq.), I hereby request the following records:

I request electronic copies of all aggregated statewide property parcel data maintained by the Department of Revenue, including but not limited to: parcel numbers, account numbers, location addresses, subdivisions, descriptions, classes, tax districts, deed info, acres, owner information, valuations (with history, exemptions, and taxable assessments), improvement details, land details (e.g., plat books, lot sizes, zoning, flood planes), sales history, recent comparables, photos, historical property cards, and any associated GIS data or shapefiles. Please provide in a machine-readable format such as CSV, Excel, or database export.

If certain data is not available at the state level, please specify exactly what is missing and direct me to the appropriate county sources. This request is for a commercial project. Please provide a fee estimate before processing.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment or secure download link if available.

Ethan Moore

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of all transfers of people detained by ICE at the Wyatt Detention Facility, to include deportations, releases, intra-system transfers in ICE custody to other facilities, and transfers to other agencies, including the U.S. Marshals Service, and other prisons, jails, processing centers or corrections facilities, between January 2024 and July 2025.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Superintendent Search Committee
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All questions asked of all candidates during all phases of the search, interview, and selection process for the new superintendent from the start of the recruiting to the date of this request.  At a minimum, this should include all questions asked, orally or in writing, of the the three finalists whom the search committee interviewed during closed session.

While the RESPONSES to those questions may currently be exempt from disclosure under the FOIA, the questions themselves, without connecting them to any candidate responses, should be fully releasable without restriction. Further, whereas the BOV Search Committee committed to transparency, there should be a record of all questions asked (written or oral) for transparency.

Given that the interviews were just conducted, the records responsive to this request should be immediately available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Marines support for "Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part One"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Marines support for "Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part One"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the US Marine Corps and the production of the 2023 movie "Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning Part One" (also known as "Mission: Impossible 7"), directed by Christopher McQuarrie and starring Tom Cruise. According to documents released to me by the Marines through FOIA (see attached), the Marines provided support to this production in 2022. I therefore request any and all documents pertaining to Marine Corps support for "Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning Part One." Such documents may include but should not be not limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of the Marines and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning Part One," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: FBI support for 2022 TV docuseries "FIFA Uncovered"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2022 TV docuseries "FIFA Uncovered"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2022 TV docuseries "FIFA Uncovered," directed by Daniel Gordon. Such documents may include, but should not be limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "FIFA Uncovered," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Jail Booking Logs 2023-2024

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Jail Booking Logs 2023-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records related to individuals booked into the Whitley County Jail from Jan 1, 2023 through Dec 31, 2024, as maintained in the ordinary course.

For each booking, please provide:
-Inmate ID and booking number (if different)
-Associated court case/docket number(s)
-Full name and last known address
-Date/time of arrest, arresting agency, and type of arrest (warrantless or warrant-based) (if warrant-based, include warrant/bench-warrant number and issuing court if recorded)
-Date/time of booking
-Date/time of release (if released)
-Reason for release and receiving agency if transferred
-Bond type (cash/recognizance/surety/other) and bond amount
-Bond set date/time and setting authority (judge/magistrate/standard schedule)
-Bond posted date/time and posting method (cash/10%/surety/OR)
-Inmate residency status (in-state or out-of-state)
-Holds/detainers active during custody (type and issuing agency)
-Probable cause milestones:
--Date/time PC affidavit received by jail or transmitted to court (if tracked)
--Date/time of probable cause determination and judicial officer (if recorded)

Also provide: any data dictionary/code tables needed to interpret bond types, release reasons, holds, or status codes.

These items are requested only to the extent they are recorded in the normal course of business. If any listed field is not tracked, please produce the export with all available fields and identify which fields are not maintained.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Whitley Accountabity Project

title: Edward Emerson “Ed” Clark, (May 4, 1930 - June 18, 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Edward Emerson “Ed” Clark, (May 4, 1930 - June 18, 2025)
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to Edward Emerson “Ed” Clark. He was born on May 4, 1930 and died on June 18, 2025.

ABOUT THE SUBJECT

Edward E. Clark  was an attorney, Navy veteran, as well as the 1980 Libertarian Party candidate for President.

PROOF OF DEATH

Attached is Mr. Clark’s obituary from Reason Magazine.

SCOPE OF SEARCH
Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA, please produce all records related to the transfer or destruction. If previously-released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

FEES

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you nonetheless decide to charge me fees, please inform me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you for your processing of this request.

Yours truly,
Nicholas Sarwark

title: Arizona Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety audits and network sharing (Maricopa County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Arizona Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety audits and network sharing (Maricopa County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:

1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Flock networks shared with me Devices List (Please see https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2022/11/17/CPRA_REQUEST.pdf
https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2022/11/09/1938_001.pdf as examples of the lists from other jurisdictions.
3c. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.subject: FOIA Recieved 2160
communications.communication:
Greetings,

The Maricopa County Sheriff’s Office has received your request for public records and is processing your request. All requests are processed in the order in which they are received, and no requests are prioritized by deadline date. The amount of time to completely process your request depends upon the number of pending requests, volume of material encompassed in the request, and the amount of redaction, if any, that is necessary.

Please be aware, if you are requesting records with large amount of body camera videos and or high-profile cases, the time to complete your request may be significantly longer as these cases are often voluminous. Identifying the specific record(s) being requested may help expedite your request. You will be notified once records are made available for you to download or pick up, or if no records are found. Your tracking # is 2160. When checking the status of your request, please send emails to mediarequest@mcso.maricopa.gov<mailto:mediarequest@mcso.maricopa.gov> and include your tracking #.

***Pursuant to ARS 39-129, the Maricopa County Sheriff’s Office (MCSO) Legal Liaison Section has implemented a fee schedule for requests for video recordings.  The fee for processing video recordings is $25 per each video-hour ($6.25 per quarter hour).  In the event there are contemporaneous multiple requests for the same video, the cost associated with processing the video will be shared equally between all requesting parties at that time. Requests for previously processed videos will be at no cost unless the requestor wishes to receive a hard copy instead of an electronic copy. Fees for hardcopies are listed below. ***

The fee breakdown for hard copies are as follows:

Documents:                       $.50 for each page

CD’s:                                      $15.00 each

Thank you

—
Calbert Gillett
[Sent from Front]
